first_reading.title: Book of Genesis
first_reading.text:
[[Gn 17,1]]When Abram was ninety-nine years old, the LORD appeared to him and said: "I am God the Almighty. Walk in my presence and be blameless.
[[Gn 17,9]]God also said to Abraham: "On your part, you and your descendants after you must keep my covenant throughout the ages.
[[Gn 17,10]]This is my covenant with you and your descendants after you that you must keep: every male among you shall be circumcised.
[[Gn 17,15]]God further said to Abraham: "As for your wife Sarai, do not call her Sarai; her name shall be Sarah.
[[Gn 17,16]]I will bless her, and I will give you a son by her. Him also will I bless; he shall give rise to nations, and rulers of peoples shall issue from him."
[[Gn 17,17]]Abraham prostrated himself and laughed as he said to himself, "Can a child be born to a man who is a hundred years old? Or can Sarah give birth at ninety?"
[[Gn 17,18]]Then Abraham said to God, "Let but Ishmael live on by your favor!"
[[Gn 17,19]]God replied: "Nevertheless, your wife Sarah is to bear you a son, and you shall call him Isaac. I will maintain my covenant with him as an everlasting pact, to be his God and the God of his descendants after him.
[[Gn 17,20]]As for Ishmael, I am heeding you: I hereby bless him. I will make him fertile and will multiply him exceedingly. He shall become the father of twelve chieftains, and I will make of him a great nation.
[[Gn 17,21]]But my covenant I will maintain with Isaac, whom Sarah shall bear to you by this time next year."
[[Gn 17,22]]When he had finished speaking with him, God departed from Abraham.

gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Matthew
gospel.text:
[[Mt 8,1]]When Jesus came down from the mountain, great crowds followed him.
[[Mt 8,2]]And then a leper approached, did him homage, and said, "Lord, if you wish, you can make me clean."
[[Mt 8,3]]He stretched out his hand, touched him, and said, "I will do it. Be made clean." His leprosy was cleansed immediately.
[[Mt 8,4]]Then Jesus said to him, "See that you tell no one, but go show yourself to the priest, and offer the gift that Moses prescribed; that will be proof for them."

psalm.title: Psalms
psalm.text:
[[Ps 128,1]]Blessed are you who fear the LORD, 
who walk in his ways!
[[Ps 128,2]]For you shall eat the fruit of your handiwork; 
blessed shall you be, and favored.

[[Ps 128,3]]Your wife shall be like a fruitful vine 
in the recesses of your home; 
Your children like olive plants 
around your table.

[[Ps 128,4]]Behold, thus is the man blessed 
who fears the LORD.
[[Ps 128,5]]The LORD bless you from Zion: 
may you see the prosperity of Jerusalem 
all the days of your life.
